item.title: Mark add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I have said that Texas is a state of mind, but I think it is more than that. It is a mystique closely approximating a religion. And this is true to the extent that people either passionately love Texas or passionately hate it and, as in other religions, few people dare to inspect it for fear of losing their bearings in mystery or paradox. But I think there will be little quarrel with my feeling that Texas is one thing. For all its enormous range of space, climate, and physical appearance, and for all the internal squabbles, contentions, and strivings, Texas has a tight cohesiveness perhaps stronger than any other section of America. Rich, poor, Panhandle, Gulf, city, country, Texas is the obsession, the proper study, and the passionate possession of all Texans." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Mark add a quote by Robert E. Howard
item.description: "I think the real reason so many youngsters are clamoring for freedom of some vague sort, is because of unrest and dissatisfaction with present conditions; I don't believe this machine age gives full satisfaction in a spiritual way, if the term may be allowed. " -- Robert E. Howard

item.title: Mark add a quote by Robert E. Howard
item.description: "I don't believe I ever saw an Oklahoman who wouldn't fight at the drop of a hat -- and frequently drop the hat himself." -- Robert E. Howard

item.title: Mark add a quote by Robert E. Howard
item.description: "My characters are more like men than these real men are, see. They're rough and rude, they got hands and they got bellies. They hate and they lust; break the skin of civilization and you find the ape, roaring and red-handed." -- Robert E. Howard

item.title: Mark add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Mark add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Conservative, n: A statesman who is enamored of existing evils, as distinguished from the Liberal who wishes to replace them with others." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Mark add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Mark add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "It is no use telling me there are bad aunts and good aunts. At the core, they are all alike. Sooner or later, out pops the cloven hoof. " -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Mark add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "From 30 feet away she looked like a lot of class. From 10 feet away she looked like something made up to be seen from 30 feet away." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Mark add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "He looked about as inconspicuous as a tarantula on a slice of angel food cake." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Mark add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "The girl gave him a look which ought to have stuck at least four inches out of his back." -- Raymond Chandler
